comments.commentBody:
Congratulations pj.

Take a Bao Bao.
Thank you!  I will also take a bow and a bough, but not a Sammy Baugh, nor a Clara Bow.

Arlington Puzzle Fest championship puzzle. I'm always nervous about a Thursday puzzle, because I feel like I'm either on the same wavelength as the constructor or not. The funny thing is that I can clearly remember the two championship puzzles I choked on -- the lower case L's masquerading as upper case I's in the clues (e.g., lago was an Italian lake, not a Shakespearean villain), and the TWELFTH MAN rebus -- and completely forgot the one I won on last year (the practice board out in the lobby reminded me: CARS(ON) CITY, etc.).

Long story, but the kids were there to watch me, which was both nerve-wracking and a joy. (To be honest, I think they were drawing more than they were watching.) I chose the hot pink marker in honor of my four-year-old daughter, and I felt proud to write all those PA's in the grid! I struggled the first pass through the clues, but I think the crossing of LIRA and TREO, of all things, gave me a toehold, and (PA)(PA)L (PA)LACE broke the rebus. I had WIFE before NIKE for "Trophy figure." (Mine was off teaching ballet.)

Just as well that the spinner trophies had no NIKE on them. I managed not to IMPLODE and finished the grid third, but one of the Mikes had LIRE instead of LIRA (I always check the crossing on that letter!), so I finished second thanks to a perfect grid.

I should say that Andrew Feist, ACPT B Division champion, was missed this year. I likely would not have been at the final board if he had again made the drive up from Va. Beach.

There is some sympathy for a lone, single mother who is desperately trying to find a job, and cannot obtain day care or pay for babysitting while she interviews.

But this is not ONE single mother. It is SIX single mothers. The six children were not related, ergo, they had six different mothers.

SIX girlfriends, all out partying and having fun at a night club -- but too cheap to pitch in TOGETHER for a sitter, so they left six children unattended and alone. Six children all under age 8, including a 1 year old.

Who leaves a 1 year old alone? who leaves a 1 year old in the care of a couple of 8 year olds? To go dancing at a night club?

I don't know all the facts in this case.
The eight year old needs some sort of psychological help.
There should be a way of providing that help by means other than the prison system.
If Ms. Lewis left the children alone then she should be charged with a crime mandates substantial prison time.
Yes there is poverty and racism in the US but that does not cause an adult to leave children alone so she /he can go out bar hopping.
It would be a lesser offense [but still wrong] if Ms. Lewis had gone out for a job interview or even to a job but bar hopping?

Wealth follows bargaining power.

Our system is not based upon "free market" but upon "free contract" which creates "free markets".

In a system based upon free contract, bargaining power is everything. What money you acquire is a function of bargaining power. (Another function is the size of the money pile bargaining takes place over).

I think one could say that there is "micro" bargaining power - that is the bargaining power that goes on between individuals, and "macro" bargaining power - that is bargaining that takes place less perceptively between masses of people. In 1930s, working class people put more of their retainers into high political office than they had before. This shifted bargaining power on a societal level in their favor eventually creating the basic ingredients for the Great Compression.

Meanwhile the wealthy kept chipping away at reversing the balance & undermining all other groups agency of bargaining power: unions for working class, affordable quality ed for the aspiring middle classes and things like ACORN for the very poor, meanwhile their agency, the corporation was strenthened.

After the 1964 election they went into overdrive. One of the 1st things was to work with the Pres of Singapore to export manufacturing under favorable terms for America's rich. The rich got richer, Singapore got richer, the American working class lost bargaining power, jobs, money and became poorer. The pattern established soon spread. Wages have remained flat ever since.

So sad. Another case in which children would undoubtedly have been better off away from a neglectful parent.

An 8-year-old is definitely not old enough to fully understand the ramifications of his actions. That is why 8 years of age is too young to be left on one's own, let alone with younger children, one of whom is a helpless baby who is bound to cry. The life of that precious little one has been extinguished in an extremely painful way, and the boy will unfortunately have to live with the consequences of his actions for the rest of his life. I hope he will get the help he needs, but away from other children who could also be harmed by him, and definitely away from any person(s) who might have taught him to hit by hitting him.
Well PK regularly makes statements about the behavior of markets when he has never taken an asset pricing class or tried to use Brownian Motion to describe asset behavior.

I wondered that about the new FED guy-I don't know his record but he was involved in the Meltdown and apparently paid off the right people.

So he may have done a good job in that emergency-who knows.

I think the concern is more of the impact on regular policy decisions.

They claim he's "qualified".

Oh yeah these people know what they are doing, right?

"How is a Federal Reserve Bank president selected?

http://www.federalreserve.gov/faqs/how-is-a-federal-reserve-bank-preside...

Subject to the approval of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, the president is appointed by the Reserve Bank's Class B and C directors (those directors who are not affiliated with a supervised entity).

The committee considers a large nationwide pool of candidates, both within and outside the Federal Reserve System, who meet the position's "qualifications"."

P.S. I didn't notice the PANDA face until I stared at the paper grid after the final was over.

P.P.S. The Puzzle Fest was abuzz with the news that Evan Birnholz was named to replace the late great Merl Reagle for the Washington Post Magazine weekly puzzle. The Reagle rerun I solved that morning had "TOURN." as the central entry, and I filled it in very last! A good omen, I figure.

This is not about monetary policy; it's about fiscal policy.

Our economy's fundamental capacity to produce is barely affected; if we had a war, we could quickly ramp up production to create all the armaments we'd need, produce millions of uniforms, and everything else needed to fight a war. Our corporations have vast supplies of capital (on hand or borrowable) to build all the factories and hire all the labor needed. Supply is not and never has been our problem.

To produce demand equal to our supply capacity without declaring war still requires deficit government spending on a massive scale. Rebuilding our crumbling infrastructure would help, as would creating a European style public transportation system. i.e., high speed rail, citywide trams, and bike lanes. The spending would create demand not only directly, but multiplied as hundreds of thousands of unemployed would be paid wages they will spend on consumer goods, and also multiply when all the money required to be invested in the factories to produce the materials required is spread to subcontractors and to employees.

In a time of zero interest, it is unforgivable for a government to refuse to make investments with borrowed funds. The additional taxes paid by all the workers and companies receiving money directly, second-hand, third-hand, and so on, could easily, over time, pay the debt. All we need do is make sure that once the economy is healthy again, no one decides we need to cut taxes instead of debt.

The middle aged white man has a high school diploma, speaks English, has two kids who are also high school graduates. All of them pay taxes.

The twenty-two year old Latino illegal has a seventh grade education, does not speak English and pays no taxes. We don't need the latter's labor or his five kids who also don't speak English and don't have a high school diploma. Is the middle aged white guy really supposed to do menial labor?

The middle aged white guy has skills and an education. The unskilled young illegal works as a seasonal laborer because he does not. It is the middle aged white guy who finds his labor undercut because of the illegal low wage laborer, his taxes raised because the low wage labor does not speak English or pay taxes, his schools flooded by people who have the highest high school drop out rate of any ethnic group.

Contempt fort the white guy is nothing more than limonsine liberalism and racism.
That's all fine and well, but they still need to come here legally.

It is an appeal to the ignorant ans shiftless. All you talk bout is the Mexicans, well what about the Asians, and other nationalities. Are you going to kick down the doors in Palos Verdes and arrest the nannies? Or haul away the gardeners in Beverly Hills? Of course w know lots of god old Murricans who what to work as nannies, or clean tables in a Dim Sum Restaurant.

How many of your friends work in a hog processing plant? Did you ever try to pick lemons? In the dust bowl days, the hardscrabble farmers could do this kind of work, the grew up doing it. Today, the farms are mechanized, and the kids drive tractors and combines. So guess who the get to do the hard day to day work in the hot sun, weeding, picking, packing.

How about the motel maids? How many of them live in your neighborhood in $400K-$500K homes?
Do you really think all those middle aged unemployed white men, are going to drive off in their campers, and become seasonal laborers. Do you really think those white collar desk jockeys could even make it through 8 hours of framing houses?

Get real people,how many of your friends are low wage laborers? Oh that house you live in, is it in a tract built in the last 15 years, who did the farming and roofing? How do you think you could have afforded it without mass production?

There seems to be a whole bunch of people that are followers of nonsense.

The top skills of mobile developers include flexibility, speed and keen understanding of the user-experience. The job of the mobile developer demands you to work quickly and respond to many changes. These changes may include hardware, software updates, patches and changes in the design. Hire mobile developers with solid work experience.
Eisenhower wouldn't make it out of the primary for he would be deemed to liberal by his modern day peers.

"...and are simply projecting a vision of supreme negativity and bleakness for every day Americans."

If the GOP can't scare people the get a fear response, the next best thing is to depress them. Invoking a fear response has been a fundamental aspect of their election communications, particularly since 2004. Just go back and review what they've said about Al Qaeda, Obamacare, ISIS, and Ebola in the past few election cycles. All of them were cast as existential threats to all Americans.

Heck, Rubio was practically shrieking about ISIS beheading people in the Middle East as an argument why they were a danger to everyday Americans.

ISIS, by all news media accounts, is indeed despicable and deeply evil, but beheadings in the Middle East (as horrible as they are) do not existentially threaten anyone in Peoria. So cut it out. All of you.

Median wealth per adult in France, in U.S. dollars, is $140,638 per adult according to Credit Suisse's Global Wealth Report for 2014.  In the U.S. median wealth per adult is $53,352.  In Australia it's $225,337.  And most of the poorest states in the U.S. have been dominated by Republicans for decades now.

Reagan wasn't a conservative by any measure ... he had record deficits, transferred funds from Social Security to try and cover his lack of revenue because he gave the rich tax cuts and spent like a drunken sailor on the military. All of the current republican candidates are still pushing Reagan's " trickle down" economic policy which is a total scam. "  Trickle down " destroys revenue ... You can't keep cutting taxes for the rich while fighting wars !  Then the " phony conservatives "  start their propaganda campaign about the government is too big and we have to start dismantling our social safety nets ! Unregulated banks gave us " too big to fail banks " not quite conservative in my book and all the republicans are pushing no regulations even further. That's not conservative that's just plain sociopathic to allow no rules for banking or for safety of our food or environment.  Former President Esienhower was a true conservative, we don't have the good fortune in 2015 in the Republican Party of having a respectable and trustworthy, conservative republican. They're shills for the plutocrats who have disdain for " the little people " and feel they should never have to pay taxes, fight our wars, or pay for our infrastructure.
@ Rita: Sounds good, if vague.  Let's get down to cases.  How would you apply what you wrote to the situation at Missouri, so that the black students respect the freedom of speech and of the press?

There is something unsettling about people who preach about the benefits of freedom of speech and the importance of different points of view when a minority students shouts down a professor yet heap praise on people at a town hall meeting who shout down an elected official trying to explain a law. I guess "speaking truth to power" is ok as long as you agree with the speaker and dislike the "Man", i.e. the person representing the power. But it's bad when you don't agree with the speaker and like the "Man'.

Political correctness is bad when hurtful or offensive speech is identified. But when people react as expected to hurtful or offensive speech, their reactions are criticized - thereby becoming a form of political correctness.

Colleges and schools should encourage freedom of expression and the free exchange of ideas. Sometimes freedom of expression can impede the free exchange of ideas, especially where such freedom is exercised in an irresponsible manner. Colleges and schools must make sure that students learn not only how to express themselves but also how to do so with the understanding of how others will react. Offend by all means but don't be shocked when the offense evokes strong reaction.

The free exchange of ideas requires both speaking and listening. This too must be part of the educational experience. And schools and colleges are responsible for insuring that the students learn both.

I understand the need for a conservative icon to provide contrast to the bunch that claims to be conservatives today.  However, to indulge in hagiography in William F. Buckley's name might not be quite historically accurate.

"Conservative" in American parlance means:

A) someone who believes that life is sacred for the first nine months and then that baby is on its own.

B) someone who believes that the 2nd Amendment is more "sacred" than human life itself.

C) someone who believes that by making the wealthy wealthier the poor will do better because they'll get bigger tips after they cut the wealthy people's lawns, cook their food, pick up their garbage, and manufacture all their luxury goods.

D) someone who believes that immigrants are criminals, drug addicts, and/or future welfare abusers and that the only "real" Americans are the ones who directly sprang up out of the ground here.

E) someone who believes that America needs to be "tough" all around the globe but if a war should arise then they are entitled to as many military service deferments as necessary, i.e. Dick Cheney's five consecutive.

F) All of the above.

Correct answer: F

The republican conundrum on illegal immigration is poetic justice a long time in the making. Having deceived the less educated middle class by tacitly ignoring the issue for years to serve Business both big and small using immigrants to depress wages of working class Americans.
The problem in defining "conservatism" is that republican "elites" understand that without the 30% fanatic base, they have little chance of winning the presidency. The other side of the coin is, by following the lead of the fanatical base led by Cruz, or Trump,or Carson,or whoever, they alienate a substantial number of hispanics and perhaps Independents which likewise bodes ill for Them in the next election.
Where conservatives seem to have gone awry is when They decided to take Everything from the middle-class, believing Their 'trickle down" charade could go on indefinitely. Now conservatives are being defined as the 1% plus the white middle class still left from Their trickle down economics and of course, the illustrious evangelical base. It may be a match made in heaven but whether it adds up to a republican presidency is doubtful at best.

However that land was ceded, the people came with it. The landowners continued to own their ranches too.

Israel want the West Bank without its people, and to reassign that land specifically and only to Jews. That is the real problem.

If Israel really wanted to annex it the way the US annexed California, I'd support that. They don't.

It's only natural to link the "what is a conservative" topic with the Republican Party given last night's debate.  But remember, the continuing surge of independent voters who identify with neither the elephant nor the donkey.  The Republican Party may be dying as readers suggest, but somebody is voting them the House and Senate majorities.

Conservative is the excuse , For the deregulation of market , To pay for the expansion of America Corp. Wall Street spending. For debt and deficit capital spending , That has went overseas, That is using the conservative views , For Policies that benefit them. From Trade, Tax cuts, Tax Reform , Loopholes ect, That is undermining the economy.. From the lost from Policies conservative. Such as job , payroll taxes, revenue, tax inversion, ect.. And supports the farther cuts to Entitlements like SS, Disability VA, Medicare, Pension, Education, ect

anon:

It also helps if you are not a despised minority.

Gentlemen,
Some glaring concerns that have not been addressed in the feeding frenzy are what the costs to taxpayers will be when the GOP led congress cut soc sec about 19% next year and give a trillion dollars of Medicare to Wall St. to voucher the system. aside from the fact Paul Ryan's plan cuts 19% of benefits,(just about what a retiree eats and lives on after all else) what will be your solution for dealing with the hoards of suddenly destitute and homeless senior citizens roaming the streets like zombies in George Romero movie? What happened to compassionate conservatism? Or even fiscal conservatism? if you are not ashamed of the fallout for what you are doing to the weakest citizens in order to offset your tax cuts to people who are already rich, you should be very concerned about what the cost is in waking a sleeping giant, the fastest growing part of the pop. Senior Citizens. Actually you don't have to answer, we already know (SPOILER ALERT) It ends poorly for everyone. As a ret. soldier I am unaffected financially. but as an American, I know that "We the people." is not the preamble to the Socialist manifesto and I am mortified to see what you charlatans have done to our once Grand Old party.

Any team which has its stadium within the metropolitan area beltway can and should still be considered as native to the core city. The Washington Football Club stadium is inside the beltway. Santa Clara and NJ A/B all play in stadiums outside of the city and outside of the relevant beltway area. Yes, NYC does not have a true beltway, but I'd consider I-95 in NJ to be the outer edge of the beltway-ish area and the stadium is on the wrong side of 95.

A fiscally conservative is what the nations needs most and anyone who has the courage to cut spending across the board including military hardware (which requires borrowing more money) is fiscally conservative and from the debate last night one candidate emerged and that is Dr. Rand Paul. I have no problem with not cutting military salaries and in fact I would suggest an increase in military salaries to make it on par with the private sector. Also on this veteran's day, I would suggest we show our ultimate generosity to the extent possible and salute the veterans. No cuts in spending on Veterans.

Both Cruz and Rubio presume to speak for and to fight for the "American people," the same as do all of the right wing Christian conservative republicans. Well, boys and girl, I am the American people and how dare you presume to speak for me! You are incapable of speaking for me on immigration, foreign policy, the economy, taxes, women's health issues, reproductive rights, same sex marriage and all the other issues of the day, because I am more more intelligent than you. I am nicer than you, and,  most importantly, unlike you I have a heart, a heart which cares about my fellow Americans and a heart, again unlike you, which is concerned about the future of my country. I do not like you or those things for which you presume to stand. In short, I do not think you, or those who support you, are very nice people. You claim to be Christians. I wonder. Though I'm not a Christian, I am an educated and intelligent man. I was educated and studied at Christian universities and law schools. Your attitudes and beliefs are so unchristian that Jesus, if He were to come to America today, would wonder just what kind of Christians you are? He would not recognize you as such. He would be ashamed of you.  As ashamed of you as I am to be lumped together with you as an American.
